title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement sachi322149@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

code: @Manual{,   title = {ggsunburst: Create sunburst plots using ggplot},   author = {Pramoda Jayasinghe},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://sachijay.github.io/ggsunburst/}, }

title: Create sunburst plots using ggplot
text: goal ggsunburst create sunburst plot without much effort allowing create complex plots bit work.

title: Create sunburst plots using ggplot
text: can install development version ggsunburst GitHub :

title: Create sunburst plots using ggplot
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(ggsunburst)  in_dat <- tibble::tibble(   level1_var = c(     rep("l1 A", times = 3),     rep("l1 B", times = 4)   ),   level2_var = c(     "l2 A", "l2 A", "l2 B",     "l2 C", "l2 C", "l2 D", "l2 D"   ),   level3_var = c(     "l3 A", "l3 B", "l3 C",     "l3 D", "l3 E", "l3 F", "l3 G"   ),   values_var = c(     123, 456, 798,     987, 654, 321, 159   ) )  in_dat #> # A tibble: 7 × 4 #>   level1_var level2_var level3_var values_var #>   <chr>      <chr>      <chr>           <dbl> #> 1 l1 A       l2 A       l3 A              123 #> 2 l1 A       l2 A       l3 B              456 #> 3 l1 A       l2 B       l3 C              798 #> 4 l1 B       l2 C       l3 D              987 #> 5 l1 B       l2 C       l3 E              654 #> 6 l1 B       l2 D       l3 F              321 #> 7 l1 B       l2 D       l3 G              159  plot_dat <- get_sunplot_dataset(   .dat = in_dat,   level1_var, level2_var, level3_var,   .count_var = values_var )  plot_dat #> # A tibble: 14 × 7 #>    .name .level .fill .box_min .box_max .alpha .angle #>    <chr>  <int> <chr>    <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1 <NA>       0 <NA>    0        1       0     -90    #>  2 l1 A       1 l1 A    0        0.394   1      19.1  #>  3 l1 B       1 l1 B    0.394    1       1      19.1  #>  4 l2 A       2 l1 A    0        0.166   0.75   60.2  #>  5 l2 B       2 l1 A    0.166    0.394   0.75  -10.7  #>  6 l2 C       2 l1 B    0.394    0.863   0.75   43.8  #>  7 l2 D       2 l1 B    0.863    1       0.75  -65.3  #>  8 l3 A       3 l1 A    0        0.0352  0.667  83.7  #>  9 l3 B       3 l1 A    0.0352   0.166   0.667  53.9  #> 10 l3 C       3 l1 A    0.166    0.394   0.667 -10.7  #> 11 l3 D       3 l1 B    0.394    0.676   0.667  77.5  #> 12 l3 E       3 l1 B    0.676    0.863   0.667  -6.95 #> 13 l3 F       3 l1 B    0.863    0.955   0.667 -57.1  #> 14 l3 G       3 l1 B    0.955    1       0.667 -81.8  draw_sunburst_plot(   .dat = plot_dat,   .label_txt_size = 4,   .linewidth = 0.5,   palette = "Dark2" ) #> Warning: Removed 1 rows containing missing values (`geom_text()`).

title: Get the alpha level — calculate_alpha
text: wrapper calculate_alpha_wo_fill() 0 alpha values non filled parts.

title: Get the alpha level — calculate_alpha
text: level integer level sunburst plot. fill character vector (factor) fill levels.

title: Get the alpha level — calculate_alpha
text: number 0.5 1. maximum value 1 (lowest/innermost level) minimum value 0.5 (highest/outermost level). 0 fill NA.

title: Get the alpha level — calculate_alpha
text: value fill important. importance argument check fill missing .

title: Get the alpha level — calculate_alpha_wo_fill
text: Maps level plot alpha value.

title: Get the alpha level — calculate_alpha_wo_fill
text: level integer level sunburst plot.

title: Get the alpha level — calculate_alpha_wo_fill
text: number 0.5 1. maximum value 1 (lowest/innermost level) minimum value 0.5 (highest/outermost level).

title: Calculate the label angle — calculate_angle
text: Get angle end points segment. angles makes segment labels perpendicular circle. angle 0 positive x-axis angle adjustment directly correction ggplot. correction applied make labels left side plot readable.

title: Calculate the label angle — calculate_angle
text: box_max numeric vector upper endpoints segments proportion. box_min numeric vector lower endpoints segments proportion.

title: Calculate the label angle — calculate_angle
text: angle correction given ggplot.

title: Create the sunburst plot. — draw_sunburst_plot
text: Create sunburst plot.

title: Create the sunburst plot. — draw_sunburst_plot
text: .dat data frame (tibble) plot specific requirements. Use get_sunplot_dataset() generate dataset. .label_txt_size numeric value size text labels. .linewidth Line width segments. ... Passed ggplot2::scale_fill_brewer() allowing change plot colours.

title: Create the sunburst plot. — draw_sunburst_plot
text: ggplot object.

title: Create the sunburst plot. — draw_sunburst_plot
code: in_dat <- tibble::tibble( level1_var = c( rep("l1 A", times = 3), rep("l1 B", times = 4) ), level2_var = c( "l2 A", "l2 A", "l2 B",  "l2 C", "l2 C", "l2 D", "l2 D" ), level3_var = c( "l3 A", "l3 B", "l3 C",  "l3 D", "l3 E", "l3 F", "l3 G" ), values_var = c( 123, 456, 798,  987, 654, 321, 159 ) )  plot_dat <- get_sunplot_dataset( .dat = in_dat, level1_var, level2_var, level3_var, .count_var = values_var )  draw_sunburst_plot( .dat = plot_dat, .label_txt_size = 4, palette = "Dark2" ) #> Warning: Removed 1 rows containing missing values (`geom_text()`).

what: Get a prepared dataset to draw the sunburst plot. — get_sunplot_dataset
title: Get a prepared dataset to draw the sunburst plot. — get_sunplot_dataset
text: Creates dataset prepared input draw_sunburst_plot function.

title: Get a prepared dataset to draw the sunburst plot. — get_sunplot_dataset
Get a prepared dataset to draw the sunburst plot. — get_sunplot_dataset
text: .dat data frame tibble variables values plot. See example input dataset structure. ... Variables .dat matches order circles sunburst plot (innermost outermost). .count_var variable values decide sizes circles.

title: Get a prepared dataset to draw the sunburst plot. — get_sunplot_dataset
text: tibble provide input draw_sunburst_plot function. See details list variables.

title: Get a prepared dataset to draw the sunburst plot. — get_sunplot_dataset
text: returned dataset includes following columns. .name: Label segment. .level: Level sunburst plot. Level 1 innermost level. .fill: Value fill variable. final colour plot, value colour levels. .box_min & .box_max: Minimum maximum bounds segment. .alpha: transparency level. .angle: angle text label.

title: Get a prepared dataset to draw the sunburst plot. — get_sunplot_dataset
ggsunburst 0.0.0.9000
text: Completed basic functionality package.
